movie_title: Hottest March ever: BBC News Review
introduction: Last month was the world's warmest March on record. The past ten months have all broken heat records

vocabulary.definition: to mark the beginning of something new
vocabulary.example: The new president's speech ushered in a era of political change.

vocabulary.definition: lasting longer than expected, but with an inevitable end
vocabulary.example: The old car was on borrowed time and finally broke down last week.
The final chapter in the book caps off the thrilling mystery.

vocabulary.definition: using words or phrases figuratively, not literally
vocabulary.example: Her anger was a metaphorical storm that passed quickly.

vocabulary.definition: suitable or good enough to live in
vocabulary.example: Despite some flaws, the apartment is still livable and comfortable.
With the current trends, a price increase seems inevitable for next month.
